==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – an image of a baby, with a large head and spread arms. The legs are wrapped in a blanket. Compare with {{zh-l|*了}}, where the arms are wrapped. Also compare {{zh-l|*呆}}, of the same origin.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*tsa ~ za||child, offspring, relatives; to come forth (as child at birth); to love; loving}}.

Cognate with {{och-l|字|character; letter}}, {{och-l|慈|loving; kind}}, {{och-l|滋|to grow, to breed, to propagate, to bring about, to increase}}, {{och-l|孳|to breed, to propagate}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|こ|yomi=k}}
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=こ}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Seen in the [[w:Kojiki|''Kojiki'']] and the [[w:Man'yōshū|''Man'yōshū'']], two of the oldest examples of written Japanese. Cognate with {{m|ja|蚕|tr=ko||silkworm}}. Also possibly cognate with {{m|ja|小|tr=ko||little|pos=diminutive prefix}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|こ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|児}} {{qualifier|less commonly used}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こ}}

# a [[child]]
#: {{lang|ja|男の'''子'''}} — {{lang|ja|おとこの'''こ'''}} — ''otoko no '''ko''''' — male '''child''': a boy
#: {{lang|ja|いい'''子'''}} — {{lang|ja|いい'''こ'''}} — ''ii '''ko''''' — good '''boy'''; good '''girl'''
# {{lb|ja|sort=こ|figuratively}} a [[girl]], especially a [[dear]] or [[desire]]d one {{qualifier|compare use of English {{m|en|baby}}, {{m|en|babe}}}}
#* {{RQ:Manyoshu|7|1266}}; [http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man7Yos.html#1266 text here]
#*: 大舟乎 荒海尓榜出 八船多氣 吾見之'''兒'''等之 目見者知之母
#*:: 大船を 荒海に漕ぎ出で や船たけ 我が見し'''子'''らが まみはしるしも
#*:: おほぶねを あるみにこぎで やふねたけ わがみし'''こ'''らが まみはしるしも
#*:: ''Ōbune o / arumi ni kogi de / ya fune take / waga mishi '''ko'''ra ga / mami wa shirushi mo''
#*:: Rowing the big boat into the rough seas, putting our backs into it, the looks of those '''girl'''s I saw are clear [in my mind]}}
# a [[smaller]] or [[younger]] [[version]] of a bigger object
#: {{lang|ja|きの'''こ'''}} — ''kino'''ko''''' — a "tree's '''child / little one'''": a mushroom
#: {{lang|ja|竹の'''子'''}} — {{lang|ja|たけの'''こ'''}} — ''takeno'''ko''''' — a "bamboo's '''child / little one'''": a bamboo '''shoot'''

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|す|yomi=o}}
{{ja-kanjitab|し|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=し}} {{m|zh|子|tr=tsiX}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|子|tr=zǐ}}.

The {{l|ja|呉音|sc=Latn|''goon''}} reading of ''shi'' is likely the original borrowing. The {{l|ja|唐音|sc=Latn|''tōon''}} reading ''su'' appears later, and only shows up in certain set terms borrowed from Chinese, where it seems to serve as a kind of nominalizing suffix.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|し|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[sɯᵝ]}} {{qualifier|second reading less common, only used in word-final position}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|し}} {{ja-altread|hira=す|rom=su}}

# a [[child]]
# an [[object]] which has a [[subservient]] or [[derivative]] role relative to another object
# an [[object]] having a particular [[state]] or [[property]] {{qualifier|sometimes [[diminutive]]}}
#: {{lang|ja|中性'''子'''}} — {{lang|ja|ちゅうせい'''し'''}} — ''chūsei'''shi''''' — a [[neutral]] '''small thing''': a [[neutron]]
#: {{lang|ja|椅'''子'''}} — {{lang|ja|い'''す'''}} — ''i'''su''''' — literally, a [[chair]] '''small thing''': a [[chair]]

=====Usage notes=====
* This affix is never used in isolation. It is only used in {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|''on'yomi''}} compounds.
* In some kanji compounds, {{lang|ja|子}} is part of the word but does not carry much meaning in Japanese, as in {{m|ja|椅子|tr=isu||chair}}. Possibly because of this erosion of meaning, spelling out {{lang|ja|子}} in some compounds has become optional, as in {{m|ja|椰子}} vs. {{m|ja|椰|tr=yashi||a palm tree}}, or {{m|ja|柚子}} vs. {{m|ja|柚|tr=yuzu||an aromatic citron}}.
* In some compounds, the ''shi'' or ''su'' reading becomes voiced as ''ji'' or ''zu'' due to [[Appendix:Japanese_glossary#rendaku|rendaku]].
